data.name: Hash With Indifferent Access
data.description:
Because we are such good rubyists, we want to implement a hash where symbols and strings are treated the same (i.e. `'foo'` is the same as `:foo`). This way we can save time typing:

```ruby
hash[:foo] = 'bar'
puts hash['foo']  # => bar
```

Your job is to implement the `HashWithIndifferentAccess` class, which does just that.

We also want to add the following criteria to our implementation:

* This must extend the Hash class
* This must *not* tamper with any non-String or non-Symbol keys

Also, because we love Ruby magic, we also want to monkey patch the Hash class to make it indifferent:

```ruby
h = { a: 'apple' }.with_indifferent_access
puts h['a'] # => apple
```

Bonus points if you don't cheat and look at the ActiveSupport::HashWithIndifferentAccess documentation!
